result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie Fuentez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronnie Fuentez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronnie Fuentez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Ronnie Fuentez was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with ct 1.  Sentence deemed served.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/15/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Ronnie Fuentez in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Ronnie Fuentez.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1 and 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #3.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; cc to count 2. DEEMED TIME SERVED

COUNT #2
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; cc to count 1. DEEMED TIME SERVED

-Days credit to jail: 30 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1 AND 2
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D.]
Bail/bond hearing on September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE did not appear with Atty Welch or contact the court regarding appearance today. There is already a warrant for the DE due to DCPS violations.
Defn's copy for bail/bond hearing on 4-21-2022 returned. Return to sender/Not deliverable as addressed/UTF
Per DCPS violation report, Court orders body-only bench warrant.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: issue body-only bench warrant
and returned.
Bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not be at the West Towne Mall in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
